trans-unit.source: How to enable publishing of native client apps with proxy applications | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to enable publishing of native client apps with proxy applications | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Covers how to enable native client apps to communicate with Azure AD Application Proxy Connector to provide secure remote access to your on-premises apps.
trans-unit.target: Covers how to enable native client apps to communicate with Azure AD Application Proxy Connector to provide secure remote access to your on-premises apps.

trans-unit.source: How to enable native client apps to interact with proxy Applications
trans-unit.target: How to enable native client apps to interact with proxy Applications

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Application Proxy is widely used to publish browser applications such as SharePoint, Outlook Web Access and custom line of business applications.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Application Proxy is widely used to publish browser applications such as SharePoint, Outlook Web Access and custom line of business applications.

trans-unit.source: It can also be used to publish HTTP backend applications that are consumed using native clients.
trans-unit.target: It can also be used to publish HTTP backend applications that are consumed using native clients.

trans-unit.source: This is done by supporting Azure AD issued tokens that are sent in standard Authorize HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: This is done by supporting Azure AD issued tokens that are sent in standard Authorize HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: The recommended method to publish such applications is to use the Azure AD Authentication Library that takes care of all the authentication hassle and supports many different client environments.
trans-unit.target: The recommended method to publish such applications is to use the Azure AD Authentication Library that takes care of all the authentication hassle and supports many different client environments.

trans-unit.source: Application Proxy fits into the [Native Application to Web API scenario](active-directory-authentication-scenarios.md#native-application-to-web-api).
trans-unit.target: Application Proxy fits into the [Native Application to Web API scenario](active-directory-authentication-scenarios.md#native-application-to-web-api).

trans-unit.source: The process for accomplishing this is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The process for accomplishing this is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Publish your proxy application as you would any other application, assign users and give them premium or basic licenses.
trans-unit.target: Publish your proxy application as you would any other application, assign users and give them premium or basic licenses.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Publish applications with Application Proxy](active-directory-application-proxy-publish.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Publish applications with Application Proxy](active-directory-application-proxy-publish.md).

trans-unit.source: Configure your native application as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure your native application as follows:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Active Directory icon on the left menu, and then click on the desired directory.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Active Directory icon on the left menu, and then click on the desired directory.

trans-unit.source: On the top menu, click Applications.
trans-unit.target: On the top menu, click Applications.

trans-unit.source: If no apps have been added to your directory, this page will only show the Add an App link.
trans-unit.target: If no apps have been added to your directory, this page will only show the Add an App link.

trans-unit.source: Click on the link, or alternatively you can click on the Add button on the command bar.
trans-unit.target: Click on the link, or alternatively you can click on the Add button on the command bar.

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** page, click on the link to **Add an application my organization is developing**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** page, click on the link to **Add an application my organization is developing**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Tell us about your application** page, specify a name for your application and choose **Native client application** which represents an application that is installed on a device such as a phone or computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Tell us about your application** page, specify a name for your application and choose **Native client application** which represents an application that is installed on a device such as a phone or computer.

trans-unit.source: Once finished, click the arrow icon on the bottom-right corner of the page.
trans-unit.target: Once finished, click the arrow icon on the bottom-right corner of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the **App properties** page, provide the **Redirect URI** for the native client application, then click the checkbox in the bottom-right hand corner of the page.
trans-unit.target: On the **App properties** page, provide the **Redirect URI** for the native client application, then click the checkbox in the bottom-right hand corner of the page.

trans-unit.source: Your application has been added, and you will be taken to the Quick Start page for your application.
trans-unit.target: Your application has been added, and you will be taken to the Quick Start page for your application.

trans-unit.source: Enable the native application to be exposed to other applications in your directory:
trans-unit.target: Enable the native application to be exposed to other applications in your directory:

trans-unit.source: On the top menu, click **Applications**, select the new native application, and then click **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: On the top menu, click **Applications**, select the new native application, and then click **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the **permissions to other applications** section.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the **permissions to other applications** section.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Add application** button and select the proxy application that you want to grant the native application access to, and click the check mark in the bottom right corner.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Add application** button and select the proxy application that you want to grant the native application access to, and click the check mark in the bottom right corner.

trans-unit.source: From the **Delegated Permissions** drop-down menu, select the new permission.
trans-unit.target: From the **Delegated Permissions** drop-down menu, select the new permission.

trans-unit.source: Edit the native application code in the authentication context of the Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL) to include the following:
trans-unit.target: Edit the native application code in the authentication context of the Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL) to include the following:

trans-unit.source: The variables should be replaced as follows:
trans-unit.target: The variables should be replaced as follows:

trans-unit.source: **TenantId** can be found in the GUID in the URL of the application's **Configuration** page, right after “/Directory/”.
trans-unit.target: **TenantId** can be found in the GUID in the URL of the application's **Configuration** page, right after “/Directory/”.

trans-unit.source: **Frontend URL** is the front end URL you entered in the Proxy Application and can be found on the **Configuration** page of the proxy app.
trans-unit.target: **Frontend URL** is the front end URL you entered in the Proxy Application and can be found on the **Configuration** page of the proxy app.

trans-unit.source: **Client Id** of the native app can be found on the **Configure** page of the native application.
trans-unit.target: **Client Id** of the native app can be found on the **Configure** page of the native application.

trans-unit.source: **Redirect URI of the native app** can be found on the **Configure** page of the native application.
trans-unit.target: **Redirect URI of the native app** can be found on the **Configure** page of the native application.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the native application flow, see [Native application to web API](active-directory-authentication-scenarios.md#native-application-to-web-api).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the native application flow, see [Native application to web API](active-directory-authentication-scenarios.md#native-application-to-web-api).
